extendedInfo.description: Bria Android Smartphone Edition is an award-winning SIP-based softphone â brought to you by CounterPath Corporation, the market leader of VoIP software products and solutions.**IMPORTANT NOTE: Bria is a standalone softphone and not a VoIP service. A SIP server or subscription with a SIP-based VoIP provider is required to make calls.**Highlightsâ¢ Highly secure, SIP-based softphone with exceptional voice qualityâ¢ Purchase in-app Premium Features like Video Calls, Presence and Messaging or audio codecs to enhance your mobile softphone experienceâ¢ Pre-defined VoIP Providers list available when adding new accounts on the Accounts screenâ¢ Multi-tasking support for background operation, such as fielding incoming calls while using other applicationsâ¢ Available in the following languages: English, Chinese (Simplified and Traditional), French, Japanese, Korean, Russian and Spanish.â¢ Winner of the 2011 Product of the Year Award from Communications Solutions Telephony Featuresâ¢ Multiple account support for up to 12 accounts on any SIP-compliant serverâ¢ Contact List leveraging the deviceâs native contact directoryâ¢ Call display and voicemail indicatorâ¢ Speakerphone, mute and hold functionsâ¢ Call recordingâ¢ Call history with a list of received, missed and dialed callsâ¢ Ringtones and contact avatarsâ¢ Dial plan supportâ¢ Multiple call support â swap between two active calls, merge and split calls, transfer calls (attended and unattended)â¢ Audio codecs include G.711a/u, G.722(HD), iLBC, GSM, SILKâ¢ Automatic codec selection to ensure optimal call qualityâ¢ Support for DTMF: the ability to enter numbers to use an auto attendant via RFC 2833, SIP INFO and in-bandâ¢ VPN supportMessaging and Presence (in-app purchase) â¢ Send and receive messages in real-time and see when contacts are availableâ¢ Connect with contacts on any SIP-compliant or chat platforms including Google Talk and Facebookâ¢ Enable your enterprise IP PBX account to send and receive IMs with colleaguesâ¢ For XMPP and SIP SIMPLE protocols, including SMS (SIP SIMPLE/SMS usability subject to VoIP provider support)Video Calls (in-app purchase) â¢ Uses the forward or rear-facing camera on your device to make video callsâ¢ Picture-in-picture view lets you see how you look to the person youâre callingâ¢ H.264 and VP8 codec supportâ¢ Support for two quality settings: Lower (176x144) and Higher (352x288)G.729 Audio Codec (in-app purchase) â¢ Low bandwidth audio codecâ¢ Provides excellent audio qualityâ¢ Ideal for connections with limited bandwidth, such as 3Gâ¢ Reduces the amount of data used during a callAMR-WB Audio Codec (in-app purchase) â¢ Wide bandwidth audio codec â¢ Provides superior sound quality due to a wider speech bandwidth â¢ Improves speech clarity and intelligibility Advanced Featuresâ¢ Network traversal â Global IP support; STUN & ICEâ¢ Media efficiency and quality â Noise reduction, echo cancellation and VADâ¢ QoS (Quality of Service) â ToS Markingâ¢ Security and encryption via TLS and SRTPâ¢ DNS SRV record lookupsâ¢ Call quality statisticsSupported Accessories â¢ Headset with microphone including Bluetoothâ¢â¢ Headphones (no microphone)Emergency CallsCounterPath's Bria mobile products provide handling designed to redirect emergency calls to the Native Cellular Dialer when possible on a best reasonable commercial efforts basis, however this functionality is also dependent on the operating system of the mobile phone which is outside of our control and subject to change at any time. As a result, the official position of CounterPath is that CounterPathâs Bria product is not intended, designed, or fit for placing, carrying or supporting Emergency Calls. CounterPath will not be liable for any costs or damages arising either directly or indirectly from the use of the software for Emergency Calls.  Using Bria as a default dialer may interfere with dialing emergency services.

reviews.title: RIP OFF!!!    Go use the FREE client, 3CX, it\'s better and free!
reviews.comment: 1st - it\'s the most expensive SIP client on Android, and has the least features. 2nd - I had to pay for the add-=on to allow Google Voice integration.             However, you can\'t make outbound calls on the GV account?             That\'s not even half a feature then!?!?!?!? 3rd - the customer service for Bria is non-existent, and certainly won\'t credit you back when their crap software doesn\'t work as advertised.    Too bad for them, as someone in the position to recommend VIOP clients to hundreds of users (I sell IT solutions), they screwed the pooch.
reviews.author: Ian Baumel

reviews.title: Worst Tech Support Ever
reviews.comment: Every time I have an issue (which is often) I have to deal with automated systems which are not reliable for a business where every single call counts. Just look at every response they have here they are all identical along the lines of \"fill out a support page and we\'ll get to you eventually.\" It\'s no wonder they don\'t offer a phone number for live support they\'d be ringing non stop!
reviews.author: steve p

reviews.title: Excellent app, excellent support
reviews.comment: Works well, highly configurable, yet simple to set up and use.  Much better than native SIP client.  N4/A4.3 via Asterisk PBX.
reviews.author: Peter R

reviews.title: after upgrade, cannot login to my account
reviews.comment: after upgrade, cannot login to my account. it always says authorization failed. From other software my account works fine
reviews.author: Nyamka Chantuu

reviews.title: Automatically end call
reviews.comment: I had been using this app for 1 year. It works fine with the previous version. I got problem after i updated the latest version a few days ago. I can still make a call to other ppl. I can still hear them saying hello on the phone but nothing to be heard afterward and the call will be ended automatically. I don\'t know why this happen and looking for a solution.
reviews.author: Jenna Hui

reviews.title: problem with facebook chat
reviews.comment: We cannot see the the facebook friends name. Instead a long numeric word. Please fix this.
reviews.author: varghese v v

reviews.title: Works fine for me
reviews.comment: Works fine!  Only problem is other SIP devices (such as my desk telephone at work) keep trying to grab the line away.  Our SIP only allows a single extension to register the line, so the Bria app ends up fighting with my desk phone over it.  However, that\'s a limitation of our SIP server at work, not of Bria.  Minor gripe: Bria does not detect face proximity, so you have to hold phone away from your face otherwise you touch buttons by accident with your face!
reviews.author: Josh Lehan

reviews.title: Problems with audio
reviews.comment: Very poor audio quality! It works a lot better on the iPhone for some reason
reviews.author: Marco Barajas

reviews.title: Uninstalling paid version
reviews.comment: Since video is not included users are better off using CSipSimple. Several sound issues giving up, uninstalling now  (Paid version)
reviews.author: Eric Pezoa

reviews.title: Not worth paying
reviews.comment: Not bad but not worth paying
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Goods apps but...
reviews.comment: I using it on my htc one x so far good apps but the issue is call qualty issue,and an incoming call when hold then no sound...i means no voice from 1st & 2nd party,hope developers will take action immediately. Thanks.
reviews.author: Mohd Shah

reviews.title: Galaxy note 2
reviews.comment: The ios and pc version are much better. Some problem with the contacts integration
reviews.author: Panos Lalakos

reviews.title: Overall a very good app
reviews.comment: A great app. Could do with 2 very important features.  1) Ability to automatically record calls 2) integration with dropbox. Then I would give it 5 stars. Must say they have a excellent support team.
reviews.author: Shazad Hussain

reviews.title: SIP stack error
reviews.comment: Every time I try and use this app on a network other then the one the voip originates from I don\'t get sound. If I tell the app to fix the sound issue I get a SIP stack error and can\'t use the app until I reinstall it.
reviews.author: Mike Mainardi

reviews.title: Can\'t recommend
reviews.comment: This is not currently quality solution.  Bria is not suitable for a business. Problems: Delays, silence, bad sound quality, chopped up sound etc etc. It simply doesn\'t live up to minimum expectations. The program itself is buggy (for example you have to unplug your headphones every now and then) and lack modern features such as a practical phone book (you have to scroll for ages and cannot search etc)
reviews.author: Compartment Internettj\303\244nster

reviews.title: hangs often
reviews.comment: it works in general but is too buggy for daily use unfortunately.   some issues that happen daily includes: - app hangs and freezes the phone when signal isn\'t strong  - sometimes when I get a call the screen got stuck and doesn\'t show the caller info
reviews.author: Aaron Chan

reviews.title: Slow, huge, no auto call recording.
reviews.comment: It is slow and it is a huge waste of system and storage memory. Graphical interface is still not perfect. The call recording option is deeply hidden and there is no default setting for that, no auto call recording. The creation of another version of Bria (Bria for Tablets which is more expensive) just added more confusion to life and it looks like a way to squeeze more cash from existing Bria Android users.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Pure waste of money
reviews.comment: Call delay seems to be the best feature of this application after upgrades. Uninstalling the paid version.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Battery eater
reviews.comment: Works well, but it\'ll consume your battery in no time. With only this app running, doing nothing else, my battery died in 5 hours.
reviews.author: Jeremie Mallette-Lachance

reviews.title: Less bad than the others.
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using Bria for a while because all functions work out the box with Asterisk pbx in the office over WiFi.   It\'s worth the cost for that alone.     Unfortunately, the product suffers from irritating bugs such as random crashes every few days and unlocking the screen whenever the phone rings resulting in hanging up on calls accidentally when digging out your phone.   If it weren\'t for those bugs, I would have given it five stars.
reviews.author: Philip Gray
